To test private methods you can use the
PrivateAccessor library on SourceForge.  See the
following JUnit FAQ:

http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#tests_11

If you are using Maven, just install it in your maven
repository, and then use as described in the FAQ > How
To Article.

It's a good idea to read this article to understand a
little about reflection.

Sometimes it's nice to be able to test private
methods.
For instance I have a maven mojo that loads a file,
and then uses it as a model instance for creating a
project.

The file loading part is in a private method, because
the load routine is specific to the class that is
being tested, and is therefore not useful in a utility
library.

So I just wanted to put the load routine in a private
method and test it there, then call it from the public
method.
